views.markdown:
• Adds support for iOS 11. • Changes to integrating with App Links on iOS 9 and newer. This allows you to easily override your Opener handlers and view the page in Safari by tapping the breadcrumb button in the right of the status bar. • Fixes an issue causing lsd to occasionally crash.
• Fixes an issue causing Discord to crash when opening links.
• Fixes some crashes on iOS 5 and 6.
• Adds support for iOS 10.
• Fixes an issue causing UIKit to be loaded into daemons.
• Stashes the /Library/Opener directory, freeing up more space on the system partition on iOS 9.2/9.3. • Adds a setting to enable debug logging.
• Various code improvements (such as converting it to ARC).
• Adds and updates various translations.
• Fixes an issue causing some links (including Messages notifications) to not open.
• Fixes an issue causing some handlers to not get loaded if one fails to load.
• Adds some translations and updates existing ones.
• Removes support for very old Opener handlers (circa 2013).
• Fixes an issue causing links to automatically open while typing into the Google Chrome address bar.
• Fixes an issue causing the iOS 9 “Back to” button to be lost when opening an overridden link.
• Improves how URLs are overridden so there’s less chance of a future iOS update breaking things.
• A long press on a link in Safari now properly displays an “Open In …” button if appropriate.

• Fixes an issue that causes a crash when injecting a tweak into a 32-bit app (such as Cydia) on iPhone 6s.
- Fixes an issue which would sometimes cause link redirects to not occur.
- Adds improved support for apps that open links with Google Chrome.
Adds support for iOS 8. - Adds full support for iOS 7.1.
- Fixes some issues on iOS 6.
- Fixes Settings failing to load or incorrectly saying there are no handlers installed.
- Fixes an issue that could potentially cause an infinite link opening loop.
- Support for iOS 7.
- Provides a new API for developers. See this blog post for details.
Fixed an issue causing apps to not have a list of installed tweaks - this broke MapsOpener's ability to override "Open in Maps" buttons.
- Added a detailed message to the Settings page when no handlers are installed.
- Added an icon for the Settings page
- Users can now enable and disable URL handlers easily from the "Opener" page in Settings.
